author: rhuijben
msg: Following up on r39678 and r39709, make the notifications for the
Before r39678 all changes on these nodes below a tree conflict were
suppressed in the update editor. This is a cleanup change updating
the notification type for only these changes.
Note: I don't see a problem with making the svn client skip these
new notifications to give the same output as the 1.6 svn client, but I
would like to see these notifications when using the libsvn_client api.
This would allow reverting the test changes from this revision and r39678.
(svn_wc_notify_action_t): Add two notification types, moving all new in
(add_directory): Use new notification for add below accept_deleted.
(close_directory): Use new notification for updated below accept_deleted.
(close_file): Don't check for tree conflicts, because these are already
(notify): Handle new notification types as 'D' for now, to allow testing

author: rhuijben
msg: (format 14): Add three checksum columns, to allow querying the checksums
that are stored in the pristine store. (Pristine cleanup, etc.)

author: rhuijben
msg: Rename 'skip_notify' variable in the update editor batons to
(dir_baton): Rename variable and update documentation to consistent style.
close_directory, add_file, open_file, close_file): Update users.

author: hwright
msg: Ensure we can import sqlite3 when it is provided as an external module,
Don't import sqlite3 directly, use the sqlite3 found by svntest.
If directly importing the sqlite3 module fails, attempt to import it
from the pysqlite2 package before failing.

author: hwright
msg: (TestSpawningThread.run_one): Followup to r39716 by renaming a variable
